stories.text: What is your opinion about software that has no fees but isn't open source either, in terms of adoption? Suppose its shown to be very robust, would you use it in commercial usecases if its MIT licensed? How about non commercial but "critical" usecases like part of personal tool set (where your output might or might not be part of larger professional work)? I know I haven't specified the type of software, just wanted to abstract a potentially distracting info, but would your decision depend on it?
stories.title: Ask HN: Thoughts on free (no $) but closed software
Hello, I'm Mr. Null. My Name Makes Me Invisible to Computers
